abstract: Mr. Bolton’s political action committee has given away more than $1 million, some of it to senators who are now considering whether to subpoena him.
lead_paragraph: John R. Bolton was President Trump’s national security adviser for a year and a half, but he has been a fixture in conservative politics for a generation, making it difficult for Republicans to merely dismiss him as a partisan with an ax to grind. There is no better evidence of the complications his potential testimony would create for Senate Republicans than the campaign checks he has written many of them.
